results:
Based on the search results, I can provide you with information about the first Polish edition of George Orwell's "1984" published by PIW (Państwowy Instytut Wydawniczy):

The first Polish translation of "1984" was done by Juliusz Mieroszewski and published in exile at the Literary Institute (Instytut Literacki) in Paris in 1953.(no content)In the People's Republic of Poland (PRL), Orwell's novel was banned by censorship, and the first official edition by PIW (Państwowy Instytut Wydawniczy) was published in 1988.(no content)From 1980, however, it was published in the form of reprints of the Paris edition by independent publishers - the so-called "second circulation."(no content)From 1988, official domestic editions were published in translations by Tomasz Mirkowicz and Bartłomiej Zborski, and in 2021, translations by Dorota Konowrocka-Sawa and Robert Sudół were published.(no content)The 1988 PIW edition was translated by T. Mirkowicz and was part of the "Klub Interesującej Książki" (Interesting Book Club) series, with ISBN: 83-06-01806-0.

The book had a significant underground circulation in Poland before its official publication, as it was seen as a direct critique of the communist system. In Poland, it functioned in the form of second-circulation reprints of the Paris edition (from the late 1970s), and was officially published for the first time only in 1988.
